us.ihmc.euclid.geometry.interfaces

Interface BoundingBox2DReadOnly

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    BoundingBox2DBasics
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BoundingBox2D

    public interface BoundingBox2DReadOnly
    Read-only interface for a 2D axis-aligned bounding box defined from a set of minimum and maximum coordinates.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default void checkBounds()
      Asserts that the minimum coordinates are less or equal to the maximum coordinates.
      default boolean containsNaN()

      • checkBounds

        default void checkBounds()
        Asserts that the minimum coordinates are less or equal to the maximum coordinates.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if any of the minimum coordinates is strictly greater than the maximum coordinate on the same axis.

      • containsNaN

        default boolean containsNaN()
        Tests if the min and max points defining this bounding box contain at least one Double.NaN.
        Returns:
        true if this bounding box contains at least one Double.NaN, fasle otherwise.

      • getCenterPoint

        default void getCenterPoint(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DBasics centerToPack)
        Calculates the coordinate of the center of this bounding box and stores it in the given centerToPack.
        Parameters:
        centerToPack - point 2D in which the center of this bounding box is stored. Modified.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if this bounding box is improper according to checkBounds().

      • getPointGivenParameters

        default void getPointGivenParameters(double xParameter,
                                     double yParameter,
                                     us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DBasics pointToPack)
        Performs a linear interpolation between this bounding box minimum and maximum coordinates using independent parameters xParameter and yParameter for the x-axis and y-axis respectively. The result is stored in pointToPack.

        • (xParameter == 0) results in: (pointToPack.getX() == this.getMinX()).
        • (xParameter == 1) results in: (pointToPack.getX() == this.getMaxX()).
        • (yParameter == 0) results in: (pointToPack.getY() == this.getMinY()).
        • (yParameter == 1) results in: (pointToPack.getY() == this.getMaxY()).

        Parameters:
        xParameter - the parameter to use for the interpolation along the x-axis.
        yParameter - the parameter to use for the interpolation along the y-axis.
        pointToPack - the point 2D in which the result is stored. Modified.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if this bounding box is improper according to checkBounds().

      • getDiagonalLengthSquared

        default double getDiagonalLengthSquared()
        Calculates the squared value of the distance between the minimum and maximum coordinates of this bounding box.
        Returns:
        the squared value of this bounding box diagonal.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if this bounding box is improper according to checkBounds().

      • isInsideExclusive

        default boolean isInsideExclusive(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly query)
        Tests if the query is located inside this bounding box.

        The query is considered to be outside if located exactly on an edge of this bounding box.

        Parameters:
        query - the query to test if it is located inside this bounding box. Not modified.
        Returns:
        true if the query is inside, false if outside or located on an edge of this bounding box.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if this bounding box is improper according to checkBounds().

      • isInsideExclusive

        default boolean isInsideExclusive(double x,
                                  double y)
        Tests if the query is located inside this bounding box.

        The query is considered to be outside if located exactly on an edge of this bounding box.

        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate of the query to test if it is located inside this bounding box. Not modified.
        y - the y-coordinate of the query to test if it is located inside this bounding box. Not modified.
        Returns:
        true if the query is inside, false if outside or located on an edge of this bounding box.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if this bounding box is improper according to checkBounds().

      • isInsideEpsilon

        default boolean isInsideEpsilon(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly query,
                                double epsilon)
        Tests if the query is located inside this bounding box given the tolerance epsilon.

        • if epsilon == 0, this method is equivalent to isInsideExclusive(Point2DReadOnly).
        • if epsilon > 0, the size of this bounding box is scaled up by shifting the edges of epsilon toward the outside.
        • if epsilon > 0, the size of this bounding box is scaled down by shifting the edges of epsilon toward the inside.

        Parameters:
        query - the query to test if it is located inside this bounding box. Not modified.
        epsilon - the tolerance to use for this test.
        Returns:
        true if the query is considered to be inside the bounding box, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if this bounding box is improper according to checkBounds().

      • isInsideEpsilon

        default boolean isInsideEpsilon(double x,
                                double y,
                                double epsilon)
        Tests if the query is located inside this bounding box given the tolerance epsilon.

        • if epsilon == 0, this method is equivalent to isInsideExclusive(Point2DReadOnly).
        • if epsilon > 0, the size of this bounding box is scaled up by shifting the edges of epsilon toward the outside.
        • if epsilon > 0, the size of this bounding box is scaled down by shifting the edges of epsilon toward the inside.

        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate of the query to test if it is located inside this bounding box. Not modified.
        y - the y-coordinate of the query to test if it is located inside this bounding box. Not modified.
        epsilon - the tolerance to use for this test.
        Returns:
        true if the query is considered to be inside the bounding box, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if this bounding box is improper according to checkBounds().

      • intersectsExclusive

        default boolean intersectsExclusive(BoundingBox2DReadOnly other)
        Tests if this bounding box and other intersects.

        The two bounding boxes are considered to not be intersecting if they share a corner or an edge.

        Parameters:
        other - the other bounding box to test if it is intersecting with this bounding box. Not Modified.
        Returns:
        true if the two bounding boxes intersect, false otherwise.

      • intersectsInclusive

        default boolean intersectsInclusive(BoundingBox2DReadOnly other)
        Tests if this bounding box and other intersects.

        The two bounding boxes are considered to be intersecting if they share a corner or an edge.

        Parameters:
        other - the other bounding box to test if it is intersecting with this bounding box. Not Modified.
        Returns:
        true if the two bounding boxes intersect, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if this bounding box is improper according to checkBounds().

      • intersectsEpsilon

        default boolean intersectsEpsilon(BoundingBox2DReadOnly other,
                                  double epsilon)
        Tests if this bounding box and other intersects.

        • if epsilon == 0, this method is equivalent to intersectsExclusive(BoundingBox2DReadOnly).
        • if epsilon > 0, the size of this bounding box is scaled up by shifting the edges of epsilon toward the outside.
        • if epsilon > 0, the size of this bounding box is scaled down by shifting the edges of epsilon toward the inside.

        Parameters:
        other - the other bounding box to test if it is intersecting with this bounding box. Not Modified.
        epsilon - the tolerance to use in this test.
        Returns:
        true if the two bounding boxes intersect, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if this bounding box is improper according to checkBounds().

      • doesIntersectWithLine2D

        default boolean doesIntersectWithLine2D(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly pointOnLine,
                                        us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Vector2DReadOnly lineDirection)
        Tests if this the given line 2D intersects this bounding box.
        Parameters:
        pointOnLine - a point located on the infinitely long line. Not modified.
        lineDirection - the line direction. Not modified.
        Returns:
        true if the line and this bounding box intersect, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if this bounding box is improper according to checkBounds().

      • doesIntersectWithLineSegment2D

        default boolean doesIntersectWithLineSegment2D(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly lineSegmentStart,
                                               us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly lineSegmentEnd)
        Tests if this the given line segment 2D intersects this bounding box.
        Parameters:
        lineSegmentStart - first endpoint of the line segment. Not modified.
        lineSegmentEnd - second endpoint of the line segment. Not modified.
        Returns:
        true if the line segment and this bounding box intersect, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if this bounding box is improper according to checkBounds().

      • doesIntersectWithRay2D

        default boolean doesIntersectWithRay2D(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly rayOrigin,
                                       us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Vector2DReadOnly rayDirection)
        Tests if this the given ray 2D intersects this bounding box.
        Parameters:
        rayOrigin - the origin of the ray. Not modified.
        rayDirection - the ray direction. Not modified.
        Returns:
        true if the ray and this bounding box intersect, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if this bounding box is improper according to checkBounds().

      • intersectionWithLine2D

        default int intersectionWithLine2D(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly pointOnLine,
                                   us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Vector2DReadOnly lineDirection,
                                   us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DBasics firstIntersectionToPack,
                                   us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DBasics secondIntersectionToPack)
        Computes the coordinates of the two intersections between a line and this bounding box.

        In the case the line and the bounding box do not intersect, this method returns 0 and firstIntersectionToPack and secondIntersectionToPack are set to Double.NaN.

        Parameters:
        pointOnLine - a point located on the infinitely long line. Not modified.
        lineDirection - the line direction. Not modified.
        firstIntersectionToPack - the coordinate of the first intersection. Can be null. Modified.
        secondIntersectionToPack - the coordinate of the second intersection. Can be null. Modified.
        Returns:
        the number of intersections between the line and this bounding box. It is either equal to 0 or 2.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if this bounding box is improper according to checkBounds().

      • intersectionWithLineSegment2D

        default int intersectionWithLineSegment2D(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly lineSegmentStart,
                                          us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly lineSegmentEnd,
                                          us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DBasics firstIntersectionToPack,
                                          us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DBasics secondIntersectionToPack)
        Computes the coordinates of the two intersections between a line segment and this bounding box.

        Intersection(s) between the line segment and this bounding box can only exist between the endpoints of the line segment.

        In the case the line segment and this bounding box do not intersect, this method returns 0 and firstIntersectionToPack and secondIntersectionToPack are set to Double.NaN.

        In the case only one intersection exists between the line segment and the bounding box, firstIntersectionToPack will contain the coordinate of the intersection and secondIntersectionToPack will be set to contain only Double.NaN.

        Parameters:
        lineSegmentStart - the first endpoint of the line segment. Not modified.
        lineSegmentEnd - the second endpoint of the line segment. Not modified.
        firstIntersectionToPack - the coordinate of the first intersection. Can be null. Modified.
        secondIntersectionToPack - the coordinate of the second intersection. Can be null. Modified.
        Returns:
        the number of intersections between the line segment and this bounding box. It is either equal to 0, 1, or 2.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if this bounding box is improper according to checkBounds().

      • intersectionWithRay2D

        default int intersectionWithRay2D(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly rayOrigin,
                                  us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Vector2DReadOnly rayDirection,
                                  us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DBasics firstIntersectionToPack,
                                  us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DBasics secondIntersectionToPack)
        Computes the coordinates of the two intersections between a ray and this bounding box.

        Intersection(s) between the ray and the bounding box cannot exist before the origin of the ray.

        In the case the ray and this bounding box do not intersect, this method returns 0 and firstIntersectionToPack and secondIntersectionToPack are set to Double.NaN.

        In the case only one intersection exists between the ray and this bounding box, firstIntersectionToPack will contain the coordinate of the intersection and secondIntersectionToPack will be set to contain only Double.NaN.

        Parameters:
        rayOrigin - the coordinate of the ray origin. Not modified.
        rayDirection - the direction of the ray. Not modified.
        firstIntersectionToPack - the coordinate of the first intersection. Can be null. Modified.
        secondIntersectionToPack - the coordinate of the second intersection. Can be null. Modified.
        Returns:
        the number of intersections between the ray and this bounding box. It is either equal to 0, 1, or 2.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if this bounding box is improper according to checkBounds().

      • equals

        default boolean equals(BoundingBox2DReadOnly other)
        Tests on a per component basis, if this bounding box 2D is exactly equal to other.
        Parameters:
        other - the other bounding box 2D to compare against this. Not modified.
        Returns:
        true if the two bounding boxes are exactly equal component-wise, false otherwise.

      • epsilonEquals

        default boolean epsilonEquals(BoundingBox2DReadOnly other,
                              double epsilon)
        Tests on a per-component basis on the minimum and maximum coordinates if this bounding box is equal to other with the tolerance epsilon.
        Parameters:
        other - the query. Not modified.
        epsilon - the tolerance to use.
        Returns:
        true if the two bounding boxes are equal, false otherwise.

      • geometricallyEquals

        default boolean geometricallyEquals(BoundingBox2DReadOnly other,
                                    double epsilon)
        Compares this to other to determine if the two bounding boxes are geometrically similar, i.e. the distance between their min and max points is less than or equal to epsilon.
        Parameters:
        other - the bounding box to compare to. Not modified.
        epsilon - the tolerance of the comparison.
        Returns:
        true if the two bounding boxes represent the same geometry, false otherwise.
